Class ec.cosm.costume.ProgramTrack

Class ec.cosm.costume.ProgramTrack 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.util.Vector
           |
           +----ec.cosm.costume.ProgramTrack
public class ProgramTrack
extends Vector
ProgramTrack is a Vector subclass that contains a list of ProgramBlocks. It is used for the animation, sound, and rotation tracks of an AnimationProgram.
See Also:
AnimationProgram, ProgramBlock

ProgramTrack()
Creates a new, empty ProgramTrack

blockAt(int)
Returns the ProgramBlock at index
blockContainingTime(int)
Returns the ProgramBlock that contains the time, or null if there is no such block.
blockContainingTime(int, int)
Returns the first ProgramBlock that contains time.
getDuration()
Returns the total time in milliseconds required for this track by adding the duration of the last block to its start time.
getLastBlockRepeats()
Returns whether or not the last block in this track should be repeated until the entire program is completed.
insertBlockAfter(ProgramBlock, ProgramBlock)
Inserts newBlock after previousBlock.
removeBlockAt(int, boolean)
Removes the ProgramBlock at index.
replaceConcurrentBlock(ProgramBlock)
Inserts newBlock at the appropriate location based on its time.
setLastBlockRepeats(boolean)
Sets whether or not the last block in this track should be repeated until the entire program is completed.

ProgramTrack 
  public ProgramTrack()
Creates a new, empty ProgramTrack

blockAt 
  public ProgramBlock blockAt(int index)
Returns the ProgramBlock at index
blockContainingTime 
  public ProgramBlock blockContainingTime(int time)
Returns the ProgramBlock that contains the time, or null if there is no such block. time is in milliseconds.
blockContainingTime 
  public ProgramBlock blockContainingTime(int time,
                                          int hitMargin)
Returns the first ProgramBlock that contains time. If no block contains time, returns the first ProgramBlock that starts or ends within hitMargin of time, or null if none. time and hitMargin are in milliseconds.
getDuration 
  public int getDuration()
Returns the total time in milliseconds required for this track by adding the duration of the last block to its start time. Does not take into account whether the last block repeats forever.
getLastBlockRepeats 
  public boolean getLastBlockRepeats()
Returns whether or not the last block in this track should be repeated until the entire program is completed.
insertBlockAfter 
  public void insertBlockAfter(ProgramBlock newBlock,
                               ProgramBlock previousBlock)
Inserts newBlock after previousBlock. If previousBlock is null, inserts newBlock as first element. Sets start time of newBlock to match end time of previousBlock (0 if previousBlock is null. Pushes later blocks forward enough to prevent overlap.
removeBlockAt 
  public void removeBlockAt(int index,
                            boolean fillInGap)
Removes the ProgramBlock at index. If fillInGap is true, slides all later blocks in this track back by the length of the removed block.
replaceConcurrentBlock 
  public void replaceConcurrentBlock(ProgramBlock newBlock)
Inserts newBlock at the appropriate location based on its time. If an existing block has the same start time and duration, removes the existing block.
setLastBlockRepeats 
  public void setLastBlockRepeats(boolean newValue)
Sets whether or not the last block in this track should be repeated until the entire program is completed.
See Also:
getLastBlockRepeats
